Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 04:06PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Thanks for your replies! I checked what treatment I am having and am having three cycles of FEC and three of taxotere. I'll then have radiotherapy.  I bought a wig!! I am feeling rather upset to say the least about losing my hair, but I reckon I might as well stick up two fingers at the cancer by changing my hairstyle three times a week, ha ha! My own hair isn't much to write home about, but it still stings that it will be going. Somehow, despite having the surgery and everything, it won't be real until my hair falls out. Does that make any sense? I'm also getting a bone scan sometime soon, really hoping it doesn't show any other nasties up! My MRI and CT scans were thankfully clear. Looking forward to getting to know you all better!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2008 06:59PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Wow, it's great to hear from everyone! I really hope we can get each other through this! I bought a wig on ebay (don't laugh) and it arrived today. I am not sure if I am liking the results, even though it looks fine. I think self confidence is taking a knock... :-D  I keep wondering why I am obsessing over hair loss when there are kinda bigger issues going on here...lol! I'm getting my port put in on Thursday- anyone got theirs already? What was it like? I feel nervous about it!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2008 02:22PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Lori- what a fantastic and inspirational story about your Grammy!! She sounds like my kind of woman! Lovely pic! xx
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2008 12:36PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hey all- I got my port in, which hurt a bit but hey, it's done now!  Hair loss- my onc said for me it would be "inevitable", but you do hear of people who don't lose their hair. I wonder if it depends partly on the combination of drugs you're on. I'm going to get mine buzzed when it starts to fall out. I am going to order a wig on Tuesday.  My kids are home from being out with my brothers. Better go! Hope you're all doing well!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2008 07:00PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Oh, meant to say- Keryl, I feel TOTALLY the same when you say you feel like you are preparing for battle! It's the only way to do it! Let's all kick this thing in the butt!!!!!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2008 09:26AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Sorry, meant to mention- my urine turned pink pretty much immediately! It goes to show how fast this stuff gets through your system! Also I have a headache now. I suspect I am going to be over-analysing just about everything for the next while!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2008 10:11PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Duke2001- are you OK? You are dealing with so much, and sound a little down from your post...having a newborn is so hard at the best of times, and your little one has not been born at the best of times. I feel for you... There are several of us here with young kids- it isn't easy. Most of those who don't have young kids do have kids and will remember how it is! Please stick with it... Hi to everyone else!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2008 09:00AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hey all! Well, I started... It went fine- I still feel grand for now, the side effects won't kick in for another few hours or so, apparently. The first three rounds are FEC and the second three rounds will be taxotere. I thought it was going to be a drip, but because I had the picc line put in, the nurse just pushed it all through that, so it was all quite quick. One of the drugs made me sting all over, but it was over quickly. The nurse warned me that it would feel like I was sitting on nettles, and she wasn't wrong! So- not too bad so far. It's done. One down, five to go. I also saw "The Wig Lady" and my government supplied wig is en route. I have gone for a long style, the shorter ones were not good with my chubby cheeks. My husband said they made me look like Kelly Osborne. Will be kicking his ass for that later!!!! The wig looked so nice that I will definitely model it for you all once it arrives. It's a big improvement on my natural frizzy mess! OK, off to put my feet up for a while. I actually feel fine, and might work for a couple of hours this afternoon. :-)
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 10:21AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hi all!  I'm sorry I've been MIA for so long. I've not been very well with the chemo and felt a little overwhelmed when I logged on here! I will try and do better! I got out of hospiral today where I have been since Thursday. Unfortunately, both my round of FEC so far have resulted in a septic episode with severe neutrophenia. It's very frustrating. I am due to have one more round of FEC before moving on to three rounds of taxotere, but they are having to rethink doses etc now because my body isn't really coping with the chemo. I'll have to wait and see what they suggest. I just want it all over and done with, and the thought that they might lower the dose and give me more cycles of chemo is very depressing. Hair- mine is nearly all gone. It has been pretty upsetting. I hate wearing a wig, but am wearing one in work. Apart from that, I am in a headscarf pretty constantly! I don't even want my partner or children to see me without! Anyhow, once again I am so sorry for starting this thread and then abandoning it! I want to be a part of the group and hope you guys don't mind me coming back. Thanks Annie for your posts to my blog! I really appreciated it!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2008 04:11PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hi all, sorry it's been a while since I posted. I've had my third round of FEC now and move on to taxotere now. I unfortunately got septicaemia with both the first two cycles, so they've been forced to reduce the dose I am on by 20%. So far, this cycle is going OK- I feel a lot less depressed. Unique- can I just say you are AMAZING- you keep tabs on everyone and always know what to say to cheer everyone up. You are a fabulous woman! I'm sorry to hear that so many people are really suffering from SE's and anxiety. It is so tough! Well, better go and get dinner organised! Hope you're all feeling as OK as possible this week! Suzy xxx
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 07:06PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hey Jen! I hear Massachusetts is beautiful at this time of the year- I'd love to go there some day, I've only ever been to Chicago and there is so much of the States I want to see! :-) I very nearly ended up with a bilateral mastectomy and immediate reconstruction, but they changed their minds at the last minute in case my recovery slowed down my being able to get chemo. How has it been? Are you as happy with the results as you could be, or disappointed? Sorry to ask so many questions, just I could still end up having it done and know nothing! I'm so glad to have found this forum- it's hard to talk to people who haven't gone through it without putting on a front and being brave! Thanks to all of you!
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 04:10AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Hey all! Just to keep you posted re: SE's after my first dose of FEC yesterday. I felt fine for about six hours, then started to feel like I had a bad hangover. By 7pm last night, I started to be sick- really sick- and couldn't keep anything down at all. Despite the steriods, though, I did manage to sleep last night and feel much better this morning. Only a little nausea and no sickness so far. I am working. So, there's hope! I know it's only day 2 though, but I am glad I've been able to do some work.  OregonPenny- I don't have one of those cathetars in place. It sounds awful, can you get it checked on? Can anyone explain to me what the different between a picc and a port are, and why different things are used for different people? How many of you are getting something like that?
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2008 11:40AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Thank you all for your responses!  Linda, the system in Canada sounds very similar to Northern Ireland/UK where I live. :-) I'm glad it isn't going to hurt to get the PICC line taken out!
Posts.Title: Difference between ports/piccs etc? SuzyWillKickThis SuzyWillKickThis

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2008 03:47AM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: I have grade 3 triple neg bc as well, and had my first round of FEC on Tuesday. It went fine, I was as sick as a dog that evening, but it has settled since then. I was able to work 4hrs on Tuesday afternoon (after the FEC), all day yesterday from home and I am back at my desk today. I still have a little nausea, but nothing major after the first evening.  I'm sure others will come along soon who have had more rounds and are further through the treatment...hope you're feeling OK. Suzy
Posts.Title: ONC CHANGED MY TX! WHO'S TAKEN FEC? 6cooks Lynette

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2008 01:18PM SuzyWillKickThis wrote: Thanks so much for your answers, they were all so helpful and give me a much better starting point! I'm based in Northern Ireland, and there are very few wig shops around- 4 in the whole country! The wigs there do seem very expensive. It's a great idea to buy online. I did buy one this morning, not at huge expense, on ebay (if it isn't good, I didn't spend a lot of money, so no great loss) so will see how that goes! I'm devastated about losing my hair- it somehow won't seem real until it falls out- if that makes any sense- but I am going to try and have some fun with wigs to try and make myself feel less bad. Nothing like a bit of retail therapy- wigs can be the new dress for me, lol! My co-workers will have a great laugh wondering which hair I will be wearing each day if I get my way, ha ha!  Thanks everyone again, I am off to look up Raquelle Welch wigs! :) Good luck and hugs to all of you. xx
